title: Deafening
description: ELEGANTLY WRITTEN and profoundly moving, Frances Itani’s debut novel is a tale of virtuosity and power. Set on the eve of the Great War, Deafening spans two continents and the lives of a young deaf woman and her beloved husband. Frances Itani’s astonishing depiction of a world where sound exists only in the margins is a singular feat in literary fiction, a place difficult to leave and even harder to forget. With the simultaneous publication of Poached Egg on Toast , Itani’s new short story collection, this is the perfect time for the trade paperback edition of Deafening .PREVIOUS 0-00-200539-5PRAISE FOR DEAFENING“Itani has entered a league inhabited by few Canadians beyond Margaret Atwood.” Ottawa Citizen
author: Frances Itani
